intro: Macrolobium anomalum, commonly known as the irregular-lobed morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in the morning, hence its common name. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with distinctive, irregular lobes, and its vines can grow quite long. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar trumpet-shaped blooms. Macrolobium anomalum is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant flowers and unique foliage.
